oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Transition metal-saccharide chemistry and biology: an emerging field of multidisciplinary interest
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: BANDWAR, RP
RAO, CP
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: titanium-carbohydrate complexes
d-glucuronic acid
chelate affinity chromatography
hydroxy-containing compounds
alpha-amino-acids
beta-d-fructose
d-glucose
enantioselective syntheses
crystal-structure
sugar complexes
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The interactions of transition metal ions with saccharides have been a subject of current interest. This review presents, in brief, the understanding of these interactions through our recent work in this promising field. Methodologies have been developed to synthesize and isolate a large number of complexes of transition metal ions with saccharides, using readily available and/or easy to prepare starting materials, The characterized complexes have been classified into various structurally diverse categories. Biological relevances of some of the transition metal-saccharide complexes have been discussed.
